intro: Agathaea barbata var. subalbescens, commonly known as the white-fringed agathaea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive white or pale green fringes on the leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a subtle fragrance that attracts pollinators like bees and moths.
